AC2019

Systems Integration & Test Engineer- #031333


Company: Space Telescope Science Institute

Location: Baltimore, MD

Salary (DOE): $101,813

The Space Telescope Science Institute (STScI), located on the Johns Hopkins University campus in Baltimore, MD, is seeking a Systems Integration & Test Engineer to work in a team environment to support the planning and execution of the integration and test program of complex systems for the James Webb Space Telescope.

The Space Telescope Science Institute (STScI) is the science operations center for the Hubble Space Telescope, the most famous space observatory in history and is the science and flight operations center for the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), scheduled to launch in 2021.
STScI offers an excellent and generous benefits package, tuition reimbursement, flexible work schedules, and a stimulating and diverse work environment. Relocation assistance may be available. Explore our benefits: http://www.stsci.edu/opportunities/benefits

Your Primary Responsibilities in this Role include:
You develop system I&T plans and procedures for complex spacecraft ground systems
You perform systems integration and acceptance testing
You develop verification plans and procedures for different levels of integration requirements
You execute formal system tests and report on problems found
You communicate with partners such as systems engineers, test engineers, product team members, external contractors, project members, and customers concerning test plans, test procedures, and operational system issues.

If you are looking to advance your career by demonstrating expertise in systems integration, system testing and requirements verification, this is the job for you. Your experience with formal testing methodologies and automated requirements management tools are desirable. You have strong decision-making, analytical, problem-solving, and planning and organization skills. Good written and interpersonal skills are essential.

Your Qualifications and Job Requirements:
We invite you to apply if you have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Physics, Astronomy, or Aerospace Engineering and a minimum of 5 years’ experience in systems integration and testing of complex systems.

Your different engineering, scientific or technical degree in combination with meaningful work experience may be considered. Prior experience working on NASA science missions is desirable. Because this program is developed and executed in collaboration with remote engineers,
experience with geographically dispersed teams is desirable. The starting position and salary are
commensurate with education and experience.

You have a working knowledge of engineering tools and computer software, including PC and
Mac tools, UNIX and Linux, and SQL databases. Prior experience in system testing or in system
operations is required. Knowledge of standard data formats used in publicly accessible archives
is desirable, with space-based systems preferred. Knowledge of astronomical data processing, as
well as spacecraft ground control systems is helpful.

You must be a US citizen or Permanent Resident for ITAR clearance.

To Apply: Share your experience by completing an on-line application. Please upload a cover
letter and resume in one document for review. Applications received by June 16, 2019 will
receive full consideration.

Explore all career opportunities through our website.

AURA, as a leader in the astronomical community, is committed to diversity and inclusion.
AURA develops and supports programs that advance our organizational commitment to
diversity, broaden participation, and encourage the advancement of diversity throughout the
astronomical scientific workforce. Learn more at www.aura-astronomy.org/diversity.asp

As a recipient of U.S. Government funding, AURA is considered a government contractor and is
subject to Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action regulations. As an Equal
Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, AURA and all of the centers, do not discriminate
based on race, sex, color, age, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender
identity expression, lawful political affiliations, veteran status, disability, and/or any other legally
protected status under applicable federal, state, and local equal opportunity.

STScI sees the diversity of our staff as a strategic priority in our desire to create a first-rate
scientific community. We reflect that deep commitment in strongly encouraging women,
minorities, veterans and disabled individuals to apply for these opportunities.

Veterans, disabled individuals or wounded warriors needing assistance with the employment
process can contact us at careers@stsci.edu. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V

This candidate is responsible for provisioning, deploying, administering, monitoring, maintaining, troubleshooting, upgrading and patching of Information Technology resources and services.
Document complex processes, procedures, system configurations and specifications. Exhibits strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills with the capability to acquire, retain and leverage advanced technical competencies.
Able to independently and collaboratively coalesce design specifications, manage and develop stable, best practice, environment specific enterprise class solutions.
Able to manage small teams and projects. Possesses a comprehensive understanding of enterprise solutions, architecture and life cycles.

* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills at all levels.

Job Description

Sr. Infrastructure Engineer
Our Team:

The Infrastructure - Senior Systems Engineer will be responsible for the installation, configuration, implementation, and administration of various technologies supporting multiple sites, including datacenters, throughout the US. This person will focus on the administration of enterprise wide systems to include, but not limited to, datacenters, servers, SANs, VoIP, workstations, domains, e-mail and various software applications.

This position requires excellent customer service, organizational and time management skills in order to successfully delivery projects and support companywide systems. Ability to multitask and deliver objectives in a professional and timely manner is critical. This position requires the ability to function successfully in both team and independent work environments. Ability to respond to issues with the needed urgency is also critical.

What you will be doing:
* Manage Physical, Virtual Server, SAN and network environments
* Support print servers, network printers, Active Directory, antivirus, SQL clusters, mobile devices, APs, single sign-on, DNS, e-mail, archives, Disaster Recovery, replication, backups, ServiceNow, SAP
* Maintains server/application and network performance by performing server/application and network monitoring, analysis and performance tuning; troubleshooting server/application problems; escalating problems to vendor
* Maintain full systems & network documentation
* Maintain inventory of all enterprise systems, applications and networks
* Ensure Infrastructure Systems & networking tickets are resolved within defined SLA
* Server and Network Infrastructure Change Management process
* Workstation, Server and network patching
* Maintain 99.9% uptime on all Enterprise Infrastructure systems and networks

Other related to IT Organization:
(Not limited to)
* Provide L3 support to our Help Desk Shared Service team and/or users with computer/systems related issues that could arise from various locations (remote and local) in person, via phone, IT ticket submission and/or e-mail
* Provide project management support for IT related projects
* Assist in defining IT Infrastructure standards and procedures
* Ensure IT policies are adhered to.

Job Description

TEKsystems is seeking a strong Windows Engineer to support one of their clients in Charleston, SC. This position will be supporting a 5 year contract and will require candidates to currently possess a Secret Clearance with the ability to be elevated to a Top Secret Clearance.

Candidates will be tasked with migrating from Windows 2012 R2 to 2016, designing Active Directory Domains, conducting technical builds, refreshes, upgrades and optimization demands that are coming from the fleet. Once it is built, this team is responsible for writing a manual on how it can be installed in the field for use.

Our client is continuing and expanding their support of their customer's Computer Network Defense program, on a 5 year delivery order. Our client's team provides cutting-edge engineering, analysis, integration and life cycle sustainment support for the CND systems. The purpose of the Computer Network Defense program is to augment CND capabilities and integrate them into the unique environments encountered by military forces. CND is an integral part of the cyber defense posture, protecting the Global Information Grid (GIG) from exploitation and strongly linking to critical infrastructure protection.

Candidates for this position must:
- Have extensive experience in designing and securing Windows systems, preferably in one or more of Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2016 and/or Active Directory
- Have experience utilizing DISA STIGs to harden and secure Windows systems
- Have design, testing and validation experience on DoD-deployed systems
- Have a solid understanding of current operating system security design best practices
- Knowledge of CND ashore and afloat systems is a plus
- Knowledge of the RMF process and supporting deliverables is a plus
- Be self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and in a collaborative environment
- Knowledge of systems engineering activities and process improvement approaches strongly desired
- Be comfortable with the creation of in-depth, accurate technical documentation

MINIMUM SKILLS/CERTIFICATIONS REQUIRED (BE SPECIFIC):
1. Must have one of the following security certifications: GSEC, Security+, SCNP, SSCP, CISSP.

This position requires a minimum of a Secret security clearance to start, and will require a Top Secret to be obtained after on-boarding.

Job Description

Systems Engineer specializing in the management and operations of a JWICS/SAP environment in support of the Missile Defense Agency a contract at Schriever AFB, CO. The Systems Engineer will perform cybersecurity compliance, operational sustainment, and other general IT tasks as required to ensure continuous performance. Job duties will include operating, maintaining, and defending the server, storage, virtual, networking, and active directory infrastructure. Building and maintaining Windows and Linux servers and workstations, performing administrative operations and maintenance functions of server and network hardware and software, and downloading and installing critical patches on systems IAW MDA rules and guidelines. Troubleshooting any system errors or user issues, tracking resource utilization and performance of systems, and performing modifications and upgrades as needed. Will be required to coordinate efforts with other work centers and personnel to resolve Remedy Incidents related to systems and supporting infrastructure. Other Systems Engineering/Administration duties may be required. Up to 25% travel to other MDA locations.

Qualifications

Basic Requirements: High School Diploma (or GED) and 16 years of general experience must include 8 years in Directory Services, Active DoD TS/SCI Clearance, Must have current DoD 8570.01 IAT Level II Certification such as CompTIA Security+ CE Certification, Previous systems administration/engineering experience managing Windows desktops and servers, office products, and a small virtual environment, Linux Administration experience, Experience with Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and account management. Networking and cybersecurity experience, Strong analytical background with accompanying troubleshooting skills. Ability to quickly adapt to new situations, a strong commitment to a team environment, a capacity to work with little supervision and the willingness to learn new technologies, Strong communication skills. Ability to travel to other MDA locations as required.
Desired Requirements: Exchange and database experience. Microsoft, VMware, or other CompTIA Certifications. ITIL v3 Foundations certification. Experience working in a DoD environment Experience working with Remedy ARS.

Overview

Every day at Perspecta, we enable hundreds of thousands of people to take on our nations most important work. Were a company founded on a diverse set of capabilities and skills, bound together by a single promise: we never stop solving our nations most complex challenges. Our team of engineers, analysts, developers, investigators, integrators and architects work tirelessly to create innovative solutions. We continually push ourselvesto respond, to adapt, to go further. To look ahead to the changing landscape and develop new and innovative ways to serve our customers.

Perspecta works with U.S. government customers in defense, intelligence, civilian, health care, and state and local markets. Our high-caliber employees are rewarded in many waysnot only through competitive salaries and benefits packages, but the opportunity to create a meaningful impact in jobs and on projects that matter.

Perspectas talented and robust workforce14,000 strongstands ready to welcome you to the team. Lets make an impact together.

Perspecta is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

Responsibilities

Using a holistic systems engineering approach, evaluates end-to-end systems and service oriented products through their entire acquisition life cycle with experience supporting a variety of the following systems engineering disciplines: - Generates quantifiable requirements based on customer description, system planning and design, and acquisition. Ensures requirements comply with client requirements and government standards through formal verification methods; - Generates system level requirements verification and validation procedures and customer acceptance test procedures; - Translates high level product development strategies into system requirement specifications and works with other engineering disciplines to develop lower level detailed implementation requirements; - Establishes and coordinates development of standards, practices, and procedures as related to the overall product development; - Assesses interfaces and integrates system elements together so they work as a whole; - Assesses performance using evaluation criteria and technical performance measures; - Translates high level product development strategies into system requirement specifications and works with multi-discipline engineering teams to develop lower level detailed requirements. - Participates in readiness reviews of components to ensure applicability to the current system and traceability of requirements through compliance verification, validation and transition; - Participates in Lifecycle Readiness management including Independent Review Team and Readiness Review teams providing assessment of program readiness. - Reviews test plans/procedures and ensures they meet the objectives of the contractual requirements and participates in the testing process to validate requirements. - Identifies and supports the development and mitigation of risks and issues and identifies and supports the development and realization of opportunities through a risk and opportunity management process. - Participates in the execution of a mission assurance program including the development and distribution of material to promote awareness and proper application of mission assurance standards. Candidates are generally inexperienced with limited use and/or application of technical principles. Develops solutions to routine technical problems of limited scope following detailed instructions. Work is closely supervised.

Qualifications

Requires 10 to 12 years with BS/BA or 8 to 10 years with MS/MA or 5 to 7 years with PhD.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 1) Active TS/SCI clearance w/Poly 2) Engineering or IT Technology systems engineering domain experience in Intelligence Community (IC), Department of Defense (DoD), or Commercial IT programs. 3) Ability to relate professionally with customers and colleagues 4) Strong written and verbal communication skills 5) Responsible, reliable and flexible 6) Passion for learning and knowledge transfer

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS 1) Bachelor or Master degrees in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering or other Information Technology disciplines 2) Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Service Management - Foundations and especially Practitioner Certifications 3) Amazon Web Services (AWS) Certifications 4) Exposure to Intelligence Community IT Enterprise (IC ITE) service offerings and service adoption 5) Ability to lead and influence

The Systems Engineer position is in direct support of the enterprise Operations and Maintenance (O&M) team responsible for a very large and complex network infrastructure. The position requires some knowledge of network engineering, requirements gathering, and assistance with strategy development. The candidate is expected to have some network administration knowledge, provide crypto support, patching (i.e. 3rd party apps, desktop, and server), and some knowledge of monitoring tools (i.e. SCOM and SolarWinds). The candidate will also need to have a basic understanding of virtual server configuration regarding high availability, cluster nodes, Hyper-V, and standalone.

Typical responsibilities include:
  • Author, review and edit documentation (i.e. CONOPS, SOPs, etc)
  • Work closely with other engineers to develop the best technical design and approach development and integration
  • Develop solutions where the solution is not always well defined but always considers the customer first.
  • Perform installations, upgrades, support and problem resolution for mainly Linux based operating systems.

This position requires a dynamic, innovative, self-starting problem solver. The candidate selected for this position will be someone who has the aptitude and enjoys tackling challenges which often haven't been solved anywhere else

Required
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or similar field with 8+ years of experience; if no degree, additional experience in systems engineering or similar field
  • 4+ years of experience with Linux and/or Windows environments

  • Applied knowledge of networks and network administration

  • Experience with installing/configuring Cisco network switches and routers

With operations in more than 100 countries and a team of over 12,000 employees, we deliver world-class gaming and lottery technology.

Responsibilities

Position Summary

Systems Engineers who are part of our Systems Integration team travel around the US, and in some cases around the world, working as the hands on systems integrator, of IGT?s propriety systems, at our client sites. Their technical library is vast across a platform that will involve the deployment of Windows Servers, SQL Servers, VMware, Networking in a shared storage environment. If you thrive on having your hands in a little bit of everything, traveling all over, going from project to project our ingenious integration team wants you to get into the game.

This position can be based in Las Vegas or Reno NV.

First Year Goals

Your involvement as a System Engineer will allow you to gain the latest knowledge keeping your technology skillset fresh and current. After the first year, you will have gained the necessary skill set required to perform Support SE functions and possibly Primary SE functions.

? The Primary SE role is assigned to you from the Project Manager for each project. The role of the Primary SE is to coordinate and manage all SE tasks for the project.?

? The Support SE role assists and is sometimes assigned tasks by the Primary SE. You and your supervisor will identify what your passion is and make sure a development plan is created that helps you grow in your passion area.?

? Shadow and then Support assigned IGT domestic systems installations, and upgrades of IGT?s twenty plus Gaming Systems software applications.?

? Utilize the latest technology of operating systems, relational databases, and network infrastructures as it relates to installations and upgrades and virtualization ensuring you and IGT remain the leader in the industry contributing to IGT?s bottom line.

? Put your superior troubleshooting skills in play solving field problems with upgrades and new installations helping the Systems Integration team triumph with 100% client satisfaction.

?

? Minimum 3 years of experience with systems installation / maintenance/ upgrades / network security/ network technologies ? SQL deployment / administration

? Ability to travel on average 50% but up to 70% (frequent and extended for 2-3 weeks at a time)

Preferred Qualifications

Experienced with:

? Install, configure, administer and troubleshoot Windows 2003/2008R2, SQL 2005/2008R2 deployment/administration, ? network infrastructure (Brocade, Cisco, Dell, HP, Juniper, SonicWall), ?load balancers (A10, F5), design, server clustering, virtual infrastructure (VMware, HyperV) and Storage Area Networks (NETAPP) configuration and administration

? Experience in CMDB, ITIL practices or hardware/software set-up and installation

? Experience with setting up network design and implementation

? Certifications in Microsoft, VMware, Networking and Storage Area Networks are a plus

? SQL Scripting as well as PowerShell/VBS/C# scripting

Building collaborative relationships

Job Description

ENDRA Life Sciences (ENDRA) has a unique opportunity for someone who wants to make an impact in emerging medical technology. We have developed a method and device for deep tissue thermoacoustic imaging that will directly address fundamental barriers to advancing the diagnostic value and expanding the use of conventional ultrasound imaging.?

We are seeking a Systems Engineer, with knowledge of and experience in the development of complex sensor systems designed for the fast and accurate measurement of remotely-sensed phenomena within human subjects. Specific knowledge of Optical, Radio-Frequency (RF) and Acoustic systems, and combinations thereof, will be of significant benefit. Delivery of systems in a medical device context will require compact, cost-effective approaches, suitable for scalable production, which support device utility in compliance with regulatory requirements for safety, effectiveness and clinical environment compatibility.

Role and Responsibility
  • Develop specifications and responsive design concepts at system and subsystem levels, addressing functional, operational and physical requirements for hardware and software elements
  • Ensure compliance with safety and effectiveness requirements and guidelines from domestic international regulatory agencies
  • Maintain cradle-to-grave ownership for system design and performance including user safety and satisfaction
  • Maintain requirements baseline and configuration control
  • Conduct requirements flow-down, decomposition and allocation across system elements
  • Develop testing requirements and methodologies and verification/validation strategies and execute them
  • Collaborate with Engineering Team to ensure satisfaction of system functional, physical and operational requirements and compliance with all requisite standards
  • Document work in clear, concise fashion and ensure that all designs, test plans and test reports are documented and completed in accordance with the Quality Management System in place
  • Engage with production partners to ensure design for manufacturing
  • Participate in trade studies?
  • Be a role model for the team in excellent engineering, designing a medical device under regulatory controls and in execution
  • Communicate issues and openly identify risk; proactively engage to propose and implement solutions to identified problems
  • Deliver on aggressive schedules, to achieve high-performance capabilities under constraint.
Education & Experience Requirements:
  • Bachelors or Master?s degree in Engineering, or a similar degree in the Physical Sciences with relevant experience
  • 5+ years? experience in the successful design, development and testing of complex systems, including hardware and software elements, in medical device market involving the application of relevant technologies (RF, ultrasound, signal and image processing, real-time operation)
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
  • Requisite academic and experiential credentials in relevant technical areas
  • Entrepreneurial spirit: ability to work in low-structure, tight-resource environment of an early stage, high-growth company.
  • Experience with systems engineering and development to culminate in manufacturing and delivery to end users
  • Willingness to travel to interact and oversee vendors and outsourced engineering/production partners
  • Work with a sense of urgency: delivers on development milestone commitments.?
  • Demonstrate clear and thoughtful communication.

Job Description

Knorr Brake Company is the innovative leader in the manufacture and supply of braking systems, passenger doors and climate-control equipment for all types of Mass Transit customers such as: METRO, Light Rail Vehicles, High-Speed Trains, Commuter Rail and Monorail Vehicles for the North America market. We?re part of the Knorr-Bremse Group, the global leader in braking technologies. As part of our team, you?ll collaborate with a world of talented and dedicated colleagues whose sense of purpose complements your own. You?ll find rewarding opportunities, diverse experiences, partnerships, and an unwavering commitment to ethics and integrity. Innovation is part of our DNA. Achievement drives our culture. Learn more today! KBC Careers

The HVAC System Engineer is responsible for the execution of the design and development of Heating Ventilation and Air-Conditioning systems and controls for passenger rail transit vehicles. The HVAC System Engineers are assigned the title of Project Engineer for the projects they are responsible for effecting.

The primary objectives of this position are to develop the HVAC systems on-time for the awarded projects, within the approved budget, and specification compliant while achieving a high level of customer satisfaction minimizing or mitigating risks. In addition, they are also responsible for generating the technical proposals, which includes estimating the material and labor cost the HVAC bid process.

The Project Engineer is the primary technical contact with the customer and is responsible for the overall HVAC system design, including calculations, integration, testing, commissioning and support to the MNA customer training department. The HVAC systems engineer is responsible for the HVAC load calculations and selecting the major components of the system. They develop project design engineering schedules and ensure the progress of the detail design development meets the project requirements, while ensuring specification compliance, or approval of waivers.
  • Review customer specifications.
  • Perform system performance calculations.
  • Prepare technical proposals.
  • Develop system specifications and special test equipment requirements
  • Develop and update system refrigeration schematics.
  • Create and update system bill of materials, and provide costing estimates per system bill of materials.
  • Development of component specifications/requirements.
  • Monitor/assure specification compliance.
  • Provide customer ?feedback? to design engineers and marketing.
  • Develop and manage project technical schedules
  • Identify component level tasks and responsibilities, and guide/direct/monitor individuals as necessary.
  • Support the MNA Customer Training department
  • Must be able to follow instructions, safety & environmental rules and regulations.
Competencies
  • Broad experience and good theoretical knowledge of engineering principles
  • HVAC Software Related Experience
  • Good Business Sense
  • Industry Experience
  • Process Orientation
  • Computer Literacy
  • Leadership and Teamwork
  • Professional Writing
  • Time Management
  • Communication Skills
  • Motivation
  • Flexibility

Required Education and Experience
  • BSME
  • Years of experience: 2
Preferred Education and Experience?
  • BSME
  • Years of experience: 5

  1. Previous experience in HVAC railway business.


Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area, including international and overnight travel may be expected.?

Join our Data Technologies team as a Systems Developer

As a System Developer on the Data Technologies team you will use big data analytics to build intelligent frameworks that support everything from modernizing legacy processes to crafting original back end systems. The Data Tech team uses Agile development methods to harnesses revolutionary tools and innovative thinking to bring forward thinking products to fruition. The team is devoted to working smarter by cutting through the nonsense and getting stuff done. If you are passionate about technology and are looking to accelerate your career while building innovative products, consider a future as a Systems Developer on Employers Data Technology team.

The Tech Culture at Employer

Having a creative and innovative environment where our techies can collaborate, learn and grow is something Employer is passionate about. We have an entire floor dedicated to our techies, designed specifically to enable teams to dream big and produce the best. Along with creating and maintaining awesome software youll also be able to participate in our quarterly Hack-a-thons or take a break by kicking back and playing the latest game on x-box when you need to re-boot the mind. Oh, and do you happen to have a dog? Employer is dog-friendly and no day goes by where you dont have the chance to visit with one of the visiting pups. We even provide the dog beds, bowls and of course, toys!

As a Systems Developer you will:

  • Work in a team environment using Agile practices
  • Develop frameworks and tools to process and analyze large amounts of data for business analytics
  • Utilize Test Driven, Paired Programming and Continuous Integration development methods
  • Communicate directly with customers on a daily basis
  • Assist in the migration from legacy systems
  • Constantly learn from and educate others to improve yourself and Employer

As a Systems Developer you will be expected to have:

  • Hands-on experience with Object- Oriented Programming
  • Ability to solve complex problems and learn from mistakes
  • Familiarity with database concepts
  • Experience working in a collaborative team environment

You will also need established experience in and/or knowledge of:

  • Hadoop, Mongo, MySQL, Oracle

AC2019

Job Description

Data Center Technician
Our customer is looking for all shift Data Center Technicians to join the growing team within infrastructure operations. Scope of work includes troubleshooting and repairing servers with hardware and network issue. Work involves hardware diagnostic and replacement of failed components. Must be able to work effectively with minimum supervision and handle multiple priorities.

Technician will provide operational support of the Eastern Oregon/ Washington Data Centers. They'll be responsible for day to day incident management of servers and networking equipment and project work and capacity management. The engineer will work closely with the Data Center Manager on projects scheduling and directing work for junior technicians and associates. A Data Center background within Linux/Windows, troubleshooting and hardware is going to be crucial for this role from a technical standpoint. Personality and a "team like willingness" is important from a soft skill perspective. The customer is currently doubling the amount of Data Centers in East Oregon/Washington for 2018, so there is going to be a need for several DC techs within the next few months.

Basic Qualifications
Walk jobsites in uneven terrain.
Work at heights and from ladders.
Regularly walk, use hands and fingers, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch.
Regularly lift and/or move up to 40 pounds; and participate in group lifts for 41 pounds or more
Carry objects weighing up to 40 pounds for short distances.
Work shifts longer than eight hours in duration.
Respond to off hour emergency calls.
Coordinate body movements when using tools or equipment
Reach and stretch to position equipment and fixtures while maintaining balance
Occasional bending or twisting of the body
Perform physical tasks all day without becoming overly tired
Use hands to manipulate small wires and objects
Push or pull heavy objects into position
Work in a noisy areas with hotter and colder temperatures than standard office environmental conditions.
Occasional work in tight and/or narrow spaces, such as under raised floors
Some travel may be required

Preferred Qualifications
Manage work and priorities through ticketing system and coordination with Data Center Manager
3-5 years IT support experience
Hands on experience with x86 architecture based systems
Data Center Technician experience
Experience with Linux or similar OS
Good knowledge of network design and protocols
Understanding of storage devices
Understanding of scripting languages
Must exhibit good communication and grammatical skills
Must be capable of lifting 35lbs
Must have valid drivers license and their own vehicle
Must be able to pass background check and drug test
Must be able to function well under pressure with multiple priorities

AC2019

Job Description

TEKsystems has an exciting Systems Administrator opportunity supporting the Dept. of Homeland Security in Pensacola, FL.
The position is able to upgrade a Secret Clearance to a TS/SCI!

The Systems Administrator maintains smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including coordination with network administrators. Duties may include setting up administrator and service accounts, maintaining system documentation, tuning system performance, installing system wide software and allocate mass storage space. Interacts with users and evaluates vendor products. Makes recommendations to purchase hardware and software, coordinates installation and provides backup recovery. Develops and monitors policies and standards for allocation related to the use of computing resources.

Responsibilities also include:

* Operate and maintain all Production, Pre-Production, and Development systems in a Windows environment.
* Perform System Administration activities to include account management, monitoring and management of system resources (CPU, memory, disk, etc), monitoring and auditing system logs, back-up and recovery, continuity of operations, security, and managing operating systems.
* Implement and monitor the Enterprise Windows Servers testing and installation of patches, updates, additional tools and future versions of all software on a regular basis.
* Meet compliance for Information Security Vulnerability Management (ISVMs) and Intelligence Community Vulnerability Alert (ICVAs).
* Perform Systems Lifecycle management including planning, implementation, maintenance, upgrades, consolidation, and decommissioning of enterprise hardware, and software.
* Manage system requirements and derived requirements to ensure the system is compatible with defined architecture and meets customer needs.
* Develop technical documentation, including CONOPS, user guides, test plans, and other CDRL items.

AC2019

Job Description

Title: Systems Administrator
Description:
This Systems Administrator role is an exciting, challenging, and dynamic position which provides technical support, system administration, cloud application administration, automation, and security support for the entire user community internationally. This role will utilize a wide variety of technologies to perform advanced tasks including provisioning and troubleshooting hardware, software, networking, mobile devices, as well as application and user administration.

This position is a hybrid between Systems support and IT support. We are looking for individuals who want to own projects and help implement new technologies, ability to work independently is key. A successful resource will be able to handle everything from tier one to tier three support. The core responsibility will be providing excellent IT services and resolving issues expeditiously to achieve maximum customer satisfaction.
Responsibilities:
? Provisioning and administration of Microsoft Azure
? Administer SaaS applications such as Office 365, Box.com, Adobe, and provide end user support
? Provide helpdesk support for employees in corporate offices, remote offices, and shops
? Procure, deploy, and maintain Windows and Mac laptop and desktop computers and peripherals
? Proactively monitor, apply patches and upgrades to OS and desktop application on Windows and Mac

? Manage employee onboarding/offboarding processes, user directory listings, and application access
? Troubleshoot hardware, software, operating system (PC & Mac), printers, and peripherals
? Administer IT helpdesk applications including Fresh-Service, LogMeIn, OKTA, etc.
? Administer Microsoft Office 365 Exchange Email System
? Utilize excellent customer service and communication skills

Required Skills & Experience:
o Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience as a system admin, support engineer, helpdesk technician, or systems engineer
o Expert at administration, configuration, and maintenance of Microsoft Windows, Office, and Mac OSX
o Expert at installing, supporting, and troubleshooting PCs, laptops, Macs, printers, and peripherals
o Experience with remote support tools, Azure AD administration, Identity and Access Management
o Experience with networking technologies, TCP/IP, LAN/WAN, Wireless Networks, VPN, VOIP, Firewalls
o Experience with administration, configuration, and maintenance of Microsoft Azure IAAS
o Experience with endpoint, network, and cloud security operations
o Experience with PC/ Mac imaging, and remote administration of antivirus software
o Able to work on a diverse range of support issues, identifying and resolving unfamiliar problems efficiently
o Outstanding customer service and communication skills
o Ability to keep up to date with the latest trends in relevant computer technologies
o Ability to work independently in a dynamic and fast changing environment
o Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks
o Desired certifications: ITIL, Network+, MCP
Location: San Francisco, CA

AC2019

Job Description

Position Purpose and Objectives
Administers the credit union's computer systems, network, peripherals and activities in support of daily credit union operations; maintains overall systems efficiency, manages performance and maintains a secure computing environment; performs installations, maintenance and training for projects.
Major Duties and Essential Functions
1. Personally, provides exceptional member service; uses Service Standards in every work- related interaction.
2. Manages multiple systems and workstations, ensuring proper integration of the components with computer systems.
3. Researches data security needs and requirements for current and future systems.
4. Performs vulnerability analysis for intentional and unintentional systems misuse and identifies appropriate counter measures.
5. Assists with establishing, implementing and monitoring of department procedures and policies.
6. As primary liaison between users and Information Systems Department, provides on-call consulting advice and technical support to various users/client organizations in regard to specific operational/application issues; maintains ownership of system operations problems; resolves if possible or manages immediate resolution process.
7. Researches/evaluates/installs/configures all computer hardware and systems software including operating systems and communications products; coordinates implementations with third party vendors and supports representatives as needed; serves as a liaison between vendors and other departments on technology related projects.
8. Develops/implements various training and instruction programs for users on the use of operating systems, networking, applications and databases.
9. Evaluates new projects and proposes systems for feasibility and cost effectiveness; makes recommendations for implementation to management.
10. Takes lead role in analyzing, planning and implementing projects including software, in-house development, hardware and networks to provide new products and services to members of the credit union and to improve the effectiveness of service delivery.
11. Maintains documentation on peripheral and communication equipment for disaster recovery and business resumption purposes; assists with annual testing of the Disaster Recovery Plan; makes recommendations on functionality and/or logistical issues related to disaster recovery.
12. Performs capacity planning and tuning of systems to assure maximum availability and optional utilization; directs/assists with hardware and software upgrades as needed.
13. Develops project scope and timeline documents for individual projects.
14. Stays current with evolving trends in information technology, networking, Personal Computer (PC) software and hardware, application development and the internet.
15. Provides guidance and assistance on technical skills to other Information Systems staff.
16. Maintains a working knowledge of Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), Anti-Money Laundering (AML) laws/regulations applicable to area of responsibility; complies with all BSA/AML and Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) laws/regulations.
17. Other duties as assigned to achieve the goals of the department and the Credit Union.
Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Competencies for this position
* Analytical Thinker.
* Attention to Detail.
* Communication/Presentation Proficiency.
* Decision Making.
* Ethical Conduct.
* Flexible Schedule.
* Member Service Focus.
* Multi-Tasking.
* Organization Skills.
* Problem Solving/Analysis.
* Project Management.
* Relationship Management.
* Self-Initiative.
* Sense of Urgency/Fast Pace.
* Technical Capacity.
* Time Management.
* Thoroughness/Accuracy.
Education/Experience: High school diploma or its equivalent; Bachelor's degree in computer Science or business-related field. A minimum of five (5) to eight (8) years of direct experience in the computer field or related profession. Prior financial experience (bank or credit union) is not required but is a definite plus.
Specific knowledge, skills, and abilities required for this position
Advanced knowledge of computer skills including hardware, software, operating systems and networking; ability to design and work with multiple linked, relational databases using advanced data management techniques and processes; development, installation, administration, troubleshooting and maintenance of large, complex computer networks; advanced knowledge of word processing, spreadsheets, presentation and database software; exposure to applications development in the Windows environment; excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills are required to elicit requirements and communicate technical information to users effectively; excellent problem solving and analytical skills.

This team is challenged daily to provide cutting edge technology solutions to our clients.

Under general supervision, performs installations and upgrades, conducts day-to-day operational maintenance/backups, and provides support for applications, such as various Linux workstations and servers. AC2019

Job Description

Responsibilities Sabre Systems is hiring for a System Administrator to work in Patuxent River, MD supporting the Atlantic Test Range (ATR), Range Systems; System Administration Team. The selected candidate will have experience installing, configuring, harden, patching, maintaining, and troubleshooting, both physical and virtual workstations and servers. This individual must work in accordance with NAVAIR and DISA policy, and industry best practices. Specific duties may include, but are not limited to:

\u2022 Active Directory experience, including adding/removing computers from the domain, user account administration\u2022 Group Policy creation administration and troubleshooting\u2022 Server Virtualization experience, especially with VMWare VSphere/ESXi, including installation and configuration, snapshots and backup management\u2022 Server/Workstation imaging experience, Acronis/Ghost/Clonezilla etc.\u2022 Windows Server/Desktop Operating system installation and configuration, including locating and installing correct drivers\u2022 PC/Server hardware installation/configuration/troubleshooting experience\u2022 Citrix XenDesktop experience is a plus, experience with application provisioning, desktop delivery, and access gateway configuration and support\u2022 DISA STIG/STIG viewer/STIG Checklist (excel spreadsheet) experience is a plus\u2022 Tenable Security Center & Nessus (ACAS) experience is a plus\u2022 McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator experience is a plus\u2022 RedHat Enterprise Linux experience is a plus\u2022 Understanding of networking concepts, packet switching, routing, VLANS, etc is a plus

Qualifications

At Northrop Grumman we develop cutting-edge technology that preserves freedom and advances human discovery. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We continue to innovate with developments from launching the first commercial flight to space, to discovering the early beginnings of the universe. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

It means realizing the values that define us: responsibility, trust, integrity and protecting freedom worldwide. These values inspire and unite our people- who make everything we do possible.

The Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is looking for you to join our team as aSystem Administratorbased out of Aurora, CO.

What You'll get to Do:
Our program has a need for a self-motivated, hardworking Linux System Administrator with expertise creating and maintaining linux systems. The individual needs to be comfortable supporting incremental software deliveries that could require reconfiguration and continuous restructuring/builds of the current infrastructure as new baselines are delivered. The selected candidate will initially be responsible for: Enterprise level automation and management of Linux systems; COTs SW installs; and Security Hardening. The ideal candidate will develop solutions to moderate problems, utilizing ingenuity and general direction or oversight. The candidate must understand how their tasks fit within the overall program goals and perform their work accordingly.

Systems Administration duties include:
  • Configure, administer, and maintain linux systems
  • Maintain configuration management of systems/environments and document processes
  • Make recommendations for solutions to technical problems (e.g., product selection recommendations)
  • Serve as a technical resource within the team with some exposure to customer interface
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team with minimal supervision to prioritize tasks
  • Perform updates and patching of systems
  • Configure, administer and maintain computer RedHat Enterprise Linux systems (primarily RHEL6 and RHEL7)
Additional Northrop Grumman Information:
Northrop Grumman has approximately 85,000 employees in all 50 states and in more than 25 countries, we strive to attract and retain the best employees by providing an inclusive work environment wherein employees are receptive to diverse ideas, perspectives and talents to help solve our toughest customer challenges: to develop and maintain some of the most technically sophisticated products, programs and services in the world.

Our Values. The women and men of Northrop Grumman Corporation are guided by Our Values. They describe our company as we want it to be. We want our decisions and actions to demonstrate these Values. We believe that putting Our Values into practice creates long-term benefits for shareholders, customers, employees, suppliers, and the communities we serve.

Our Responsibility. At Northrop Grumman, we are committed to maintaining the highest of ethical standards, embracing diversity and inclusion, protecting the environment, and striving to be an ideal corporate citizen in the community and in the world.

Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is seeking a Systems Administrator Engineer to support an IT infrastructure network consolidation program in Fairfax, VA. The System Administrator will be a member of the Engineering, Sciences & Technology (ES&T) Eastern Region homeroom. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to design, develop, produce and sustain product lines across while providing a decisive advantage to our customer's missions.

A Systems Administrator maintains smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including coordination with network administrators. Interacts with users and evaluates vendor products. Makes recommendations to purchase hardware and software, coordinates installation and provides backup recovery. Develops and monitors policies and standards for allocation related to the use of computing resources. Ancillary duties may include setting up administrator and service accounts, maintaining system documentation, tuning system performance, installing system wide software and allocating mass storage space.

The Systems Administrator position will be located in Fairfax, VA. This requisition may be filled at a higher grade based on qualifications listed below.

Position Description:

* Deploy/test monthly patch updates to Window machines.

* Deploy, manage, maintain, and support Microsoft Window servers and workstations.

* Create and configure VMs with VMWare vSphere.

* Create user accounts and administer user privileges within active directory.

* Deploy/test monthly patch updates (rpms) to RHEL servers.

* Assist with implementation of automated processes or functions to improve daily operations as directed.

* Assist with implementation of technical security technology and IT project.

* Deploy AV server and client products.

* Integrate updated management/monitoring tools.

* Collaborate in authoring system documentation and procedures.

Basic Qualifications - To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below. This requisition may be filled at a higher grade based on qualifications listed below. This requisition may be filled at either a level 2 or 3.

* Bachelor's Degree and a minimum of 3 years' experience required for the level 2 role. An additional 4 years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.

* Bachelor's Degree and a minimum of 6 years' experience required for the level 3 role. An additional 4 years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.

* Active TS/SCI clearance with CI polygraph required.

* Security+ Certification required.

* Experience loading, configuring, maintaining, and troubleshooting Windows operating systems, including Windows Server and Windows 7.

* Experience with virtualization and/or cloud technologies such as VMWare vSphere, Oracle PCA, Hyper-V, or Amazon Web Services.

* Strong background in Windows administration including Active Directory, Group Policy, and WSUS.

Preferred Qualifications - Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:

* Experience with implementing infrastructures within Amazon Web Services.

* Experience with Linux/Unix system administration.

* CompTIA Security+ Certification or equivalent DoD 8570 IAT II or III certification.

* Scripting experience with bash, Python, or PowerShell.

* Experience with automation tools such as Puppet, Chef, or Ansible.

* Strong working knowledge of IP address/Networking theory including common command line tools and commonly used ports to troubleshot and test network/connectivity issues.

* Familiarity with Firewall types/theory and configuration of OS installed FWs.

* Experience with Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems to include rpm management, user account management, dns, centrify, and AV tools.

* Familiarity with DB products/theory including Oracle, mySql, and MS SQL.

* Familiarity with SNMP operation, configuration.

* Strong working knowledge of DNS, zone management and IPAM.

Northrop Grumman Enterprise Services is seeking a well-qualified Windows Administrator to join its dynamic team of technical professionals in the San Diego, CA area.

Roles and responsibilities include:

Perform as a Windows System Administrator for a classified government contract
Able to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization, with internal or external customers, in written and oral format.
Maintain smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including coordination with network, software, and system engineers, PC desktop technicians, project managers, end users, and customer and IT management.
Able to support multiple networks. Ensure necessary administration tasks are completed; direct others as necessary.
Analyze internal or external customer requirements and determine equipment and software requirements for solutions to problems by means of automated systems.
Recommend and implement system enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of the system including installing, upgrading/patching, monitoring, problem resolution, and configuration management.
Provide backup and recovery services; manage file systems and disk space; manage virus protection on a routine basis.
Create and maintain user and computer accounts and modify file permissions and security access lists.
Test new releases of products to ensure compatibility and minimize user impact.
Develop and document technical processes and procedures as needed.
Make recommendations to purchase hardware, software, system components.
Interact, meet, discuss, and troubleshoot issues with vendors; evaluate vendor products, services, and suggestions.
Adhere to strict Information Systems security guidelines in all cases.
Maintain security audit and logging information on all classified networked and standalone computers as directed by the Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM).
Prepare security documentation for input to Computer Security.
Report project status as required for all recurring and non-recurring efforts.
Works under minimal direction and independently determines and develops approach to solutions.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree and 5 years of related experience; Master's degree and 3 years of relevant IT experience;or 7 years of relevant experience with an Associates degree; or 9 years of relevant experience with a HS diploma.
Current Security + CE or ability to obtain within 6 months of hire
Ability to maintain an active clearance
Ability to be cleared to special access programs
Ability to lift equipment weighing up to 40 pounds
Ability to work after hours and weekends as needed
US citizenship is required in order to obtain and maintain security clearance
Experience managing Windows Server OS

Preferred Qualifications:

Candidates with these desired skills may be given preferred consideration:

Bachelors or Masters degree in IS related field

Experience operating under and managing systems within NISPOM Chapter 8, DCID 6/3-ICD 503, RMF, STIG, JAFAN, or JSIG information system environments
Experience installing, configuring, and maintaining computer hardware in a networked environment
Server management
Currently valid Security+ CE, CASP, CISSP or similar security certification
Windows domain architecture experience
Understanding basic networking, including subnets, routing, and VLANs; Cisco experience and/or certification
Windows AD, LDAP, VMWare, and knowledge of SAN storage systems
Linux Operating System experience and/or certification for current versions
VMWare experience with current version
Knowledge of environmental monitoring tools (HBSS/Solar Winds/Splunk)
Rudimentary Scripting
Creation and deployment of system images in an enterprise environment
Experience with Certification & Accreditation process
DoD 8570 Certification in a primary OS (Windows, Linux, Cisco)
Currently Active Top Secret/SCI Clearance

Northrop Grumman has approximately 85,000 employees in all 50 states and in more than 25 countries, we strive to attract and retain the best employees by providing an inclusive work environment wherein employees are receptive to diverse ideas, perspectives and talents to help solve our toughest customer challenges: to develop and maintain some of the most technically sophisticated products, programs and services in the world.

What You'll get to Do:
You will be responsible for maintaining smooth operation of unclassified / classified multi-user computer systems.

Duties will include:
  • Interaction with users to determine hardware/software requirements and installation and configuration of hardware, operating systems and COTS.
  • Ancillary duties will include, but are not limited to: evaluation of vendor products, providing recommendations to purchase hardware and software, providing backup recovery, maintaining system documentation, tuning system performance, building of systems and computing asset management.
  • Applicant must be experienced in STIG configuration, classified processing, and security procedures.

This position can be filled at a Sys Admin or Principal Sys Admin level.

  • Bachelor's Degree with3 years of relevant experience; Master's Degree with 1 yearof relevantexperienceor 7 years of relevant experience in lieu of a completed degree
  • Experience with systems administration of Windows, Linux, and/or VMware
  • Experience managing a highly virtualized testing lab
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Security+ certification
  • Ability to obtain a DoD Top Secret Clearance or SCI Clearance
  • Ability to obtain SAP Clearance
Basic Qualifications for a Principal Sys Admin:
  • Bachelor's Degree with6 years of relevant experience; Master's Degree with4 years of relevant experienceor 10years of relevant experience in lieu of a completed degree
  • Experience with systems administration of Windows, Linux, and/or VMware
  • Experience managing a highly virtualized testing lab
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Security+ certification
  • Ability to obtain a DoD Top Secret Clearance or SCI Clearance
  • Ability to obtain SAP Clearance
Preferred Qualifications:

  • Cisco networking to include routing, switching and firewalls
  • Familiarity with NAS and SAN technologies (NetApp SAN, EMC SAN, HP NAS)
  • CISSP or Microsoft OS Certification

Job Description:

Are you ready for your next mission? If so, consider the Leidos team! This is a fantastic opportunity to work with a team of highly trained and a talented professionals.

The Systems Administrator will be a key part of the IT team supporting the ARIES contract and will be responsible for physical and virtual server operations & maintenance, storage area network support, basic and advanced Active Directory tasks, and troubleshooting on server, network, and desktop systems & office automation in support of the Service Desk. This position will be based at Ft. Bragg, NC. This role is sign on bonus eligible for the right candidate.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Install, administer, and maintain Windows servers, desktops, and laptops as part of the overall systems architecture across multiple networks and locations; strong understanding of and experience with Active Directory
  • Install, administer and maintain virtual environments (VMware 6.5) and physical hosts
  • Install, administer and maintain storage devices (NetApp) across multiple locations
  • Utilize physical inspection and GUI-based and/or command line tools (especially PowerShell) to troubleshoot basic to complex systems hardware, software, and configuration issues with systems, networks, Active Directory.
  • Develop, implement, and manage disaster recovery and COOP plans, systems, and operations in coordination with the Network team and other organizations
  • Basic network troubleshooting in support of the datacenter and workstation/LAN connectivity
  • Work with teammates as needed to document service structure, network, and server/storage architecture and ensure data security and availability for customers both local and deployed across multiple regions
  • Collect, review, and store server log files to identify and remediate system issues
  • Document system configurations using Visio, PowerPoint, Word, or other tools and propose, defend, and implement system changes; coordinate & assist cybersecurity personnel and teammates with system accreditation efforts
  • Apply security patches, IAVAs, STIGS, and updates (including operating system updates) for all assigned systems
  • Assist Service Desk technicians as needed with Tier I and Tier II troubleshooting and patching of desktop systems, software (MS Office, Java, Adobe, etc), printer issues, and server/network related issues
  • Mentor, lead, and train junior technicians as directed; fill in for site lead as needed/directed.
  • Participate in or lead special projects and daytoday operations as needed or assigned by the site lead, including surging to alternate locations for customer requirements or to backfill personnel during R&R or other absences


Basic Qualifications:
  • Active TS/SCI security clearance
  • Bachelor's degree with 4+ years of related experience. Additional years of experience may serve in lieu of a degree
  • Experience managing a Virtualization solutions such as VMware and with deploying Windows Server 2008 R2 & 2012 R2
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills; Willingness to work as part of a team, both as member or as a leader
  • Ability to maintain workload in a fast paced environment with rapidly changing priorities
  • Currently possess DoD 8570.01 certification at IAT Level II, such as Security+CE


Preferred Qualifications:
  • Currently possess MCSA: Windows Server 2012 or MCSA: Windows Server 2016
  • Currently possess MCSE: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure
  • ITILv3 certification.


Sign on bonus eligible

Job Description:

Leidos has a current job opportunity for a Windows/UNIX System Administrator supporting our software development programs in Morgantown, WV. Position requires US citizenship and ability to obtain a DoD Secret Security Clearance for consideration.

The System Administrator is respo n sib l e f o r managing configuration and operation of client/server based reporting systems for multiple DOD and Commercial programs. Optimizes system operation and resource utilization and performs system capacity analysis and planning. Provides assistance to users in accessing and using systems. Also responsible for administering, monitoring, and maintaining VMware ESXi, OSX, Windows, and Linux. As required, candidate will also need to provide system administration instruction to users in the field, relative to DOD programs.

Primary Responsibilities:

You will provide support in the following areas and manage associated system infrastructures and any processes related to these systems:
  • Implementation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of multiple systems (both customer-facing and internal programs).
  • Troubleshooting affected systems in lab environment and deployed systems (possibly via HelpDesk if applicable), including day-to-day operations, monitoring, and problem resolution for all client problems.
  • Problem identification, diagnosis, and resolution.
  • Dispatching system and hardware problems and remain involved in the resolution process.
  • Escalation and communication of status to other Tier Help Desks, government management, and internal customers. Must have experience in one or more systems and architectures and associated hardware: client/server based.
  • May be tasked with creating, maintaining and coordinating project activities with multiple components.
  • Work with engineers from other projects and organizations to leverage on-board expertise to support existing and future implementations.
  • You will be required to engage with Air Force system administrators at their bases to help install and/or troubleshoot a software program maintained by Leidos. Instruction materials already exist; however, the candidate should be comfortable engaging and training a wide range of users and rank within the military hierarchy.


Basic Qualifications:
  • Bac h elor's d e gree or higher and a minimum of 8-12 years' experience (or Master's degree and a minimum of 7-10 years' experience)
  • Experience maintaining and configuring the following: ESXi Server, LAN/WAN Equipment, Windows Servers, Windows PCs, MacOSX, Oracle, and Weblogic
  • Must exhibit reasonable technical expertise in engineering, testing and supporting various technologies including Windows/Unix servers, virtual machines, clustering, routers, firewalls, and network security.
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills are a must.
  • Must have the ability of obtaining a DoD Secret Security Clearance.
  • U.S. Citizenship required.
  • Must have the ability of obtaining Public Trust


Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience configuring and managing Windows 2008 Server
  • Experience administering Oracle databases
  • Experience with ESXi Server virtualization software
  • Experience with Weblogic
  • Experience with Failover Cluster Manager
  • Experience with batch scripting
  • Familiarity with Puppet
  • Familiarity with security products: Web Application Firewall, DDoS, VPN, IAM
  • Familiarity with scaling & load balancing web applications
  • Familiarity with various DoD Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs)
  • DSS Baseline Technical Security Configurations
  • Familiarity with OSX

Job Description

Genesis10 is seeking a System Administrator for a leading Telecommunications company. This is direct hire role and must be onsite in Jonesboro, AR.
?
Job Summary:?
The System Administrator is responsible for the installation, operation, monitoring, maintenance and repair of server infrastructures, the associated operating systems, and application software. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills as well as a desire to learn and grow with the System Administration and IT teams. This person will support the Cloud team.
Job Duties:
  • Control, monitor and test servers, printers, workstations and other device usage and resources.
  • Works to establish and deploy security standards and provide security administration.
  • Experience with Virtual Desktop environments or DaaS.
  • Acquire knowledge of current business processes and system via interview, process documentation and observation.
  • Prepare "gap analysis " or needed assessment documentation based on current state and desired requirements.
  • Evaluate fitness of hardware/software solutions on a regular basis.
  • Work to establish and deploy security standards, and security documentation.
  • Test programs and equipment on a regular basis.
  • Recommend replacement of obsolete or damaged equipment.
  • Recommend cost effective procedures and technologies.
  • Maintains network applications including servers, SAN, NAS, cabling, and backup systems.
  • Backup software and other service provider applications.
  • Ensures the continuing operation of server hardware by proactively identifying issues and resolving those issues.
  • Preforms and analyzes packet captures when needed.
  • Adds and maintains users on the network; assigning application access, ensuring security, and maintaining their configurations are within standards.
  • Provides technical support to Network Operations for data networks, ISP protocols, service system issues, and various customer service issues.
  • Installs new software applications or hardware on the LAN, coordinating assistance form third parties when necessary.
  • Ability to work tickets in a timely manner to meet SLAs.
  • Ability to read and comprehend industry standard logs and be proactive.
  • Updates manual server logs quarterly documenting changes in the system and network configuration.
  • Conducts integrity checks and backups as needed.
  • Understand the fundamentals of modern data protection methodologies (both physical and virtual machines), be willing to become a SME in data protection and drive company towards future solutions for customers.
  • Understand virtualization at a deep level; be willing to drive future customer solutions.
  • Participates in on-call rotation.
Requirements:
  • Knowledge of computer network system design, development methods, and techniques.
  • Experience with Hyper-V, Azure, and Cisco
  • Knowledge of computer logic, block diagramming and flow charting.
  • Knowledge of standard computer languages.
  • Knowledge of operations and security configurations in Windows and Linux environments.
  • Knowledge of capabilities, utilization, and limitations of data processing equipment.
  • Knowledge of network management practices and procedures.
  • Knowledge of desire to learn PowerShell and REST API.
  • Keen interest in Microsoft Cloud Platform
  • Skill in operating various office equipment such as personal computer, various software programs, and telephone systems.
  • Skill in problem resolution.
  • Skill in reading and interpreting technical documents and information.
  • Ability to communicate with customers, employees, and various business contacts in a professional and courteous manner.
  • Extremely customer driven/focused and with ability to match and speak at the customer technical level.
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, or related field, plus five years of related professional experience or an equivalent combination of education and experiences is required.? Related certifications preferred.? Must hold or be willing to gain advanced certifications in any of the hosted technologies (Mircrosoft, Cisco, VMWare, Veeam) within 18 months.

  • Isolate and resolve hardware and software problems involving the applications, the operating system, the hardware, the communications infrastructure, or any combination thereof
  • Troubleshoot, maintain integrity and configure network components along with implementing operating systems enhancements to improve reliability and performance
  • Integrate new technologies into new and existing systems including the transition and migration of corporate systems.
  • Execution of on-site, on the floor, technical and system administration support
  • Support requirements for managing installation, configuration and maintenance of Unix/Windows workstations and servers, including Web servers, network attached storage devices, and stored data in support of business processing requirements
  • Perform software installations and upgrades to Unix/Windows operating systems and layered software packages and maintains them in accordance with established policies, procedures and service level agreements; evaluation and installation of software/hardware patches and resolution of software related problems associated with COTS/GOTS products
  • Assist with achieving optimum performance and availability standards through implementing appropriate technical solutions.
  • Attend meetings weekly and provide weekly status reports.
  • Resolve a wide range of system issues, troubleshooting software, hardware, diagnosis of network issues, and addressing trouble tickets and service tasks across all tiered levels.
  • Attend Authorized Outage, Firewall Change Request, and Root Cause Analysis Boards as required
  • Create and follow procedures to maintain and manage multiple linked databases including security, data safety and integrity, disaster recovery, and bulk data import/exports.
  • Conduct routine and emergency maintenance of assigned data center equipment
  • Communicate/coordinate scheduled preventive maintenance windows with potentially impacted customers
  • Collaborate and contribute to the development, administration, and testing of backup and recovery plans
  • Ensure systems are secure to STIG guidelines by utilizing tools such as Retina and HBSS
  • Maintain operational, configuration, and other standard operating procedures (SOPs).
  • Verify system availability with existing Enterprise tools
  • May serve in a supervisory capacity

Company Job Title:

Systems Administrator

Chenega Job Title:

Administrator III, Systems

Clearance:

Ability to obtain TS/SCI

Location:

O'Fallon IL

Reports To:

Program Manager and/or Tech Lead

FLSA Status:

Exempt, Full Time, Regular

Prepared Date:

05-24-2019

Approved Date:

06-03-2019

Summary:

The Administrator Senior will have primary responsibility for
supporting an operational mission critical system from the St. Louis area. The Systems Administrator will work closely
with both local and remote users, as well as both contractor and Government
teams.

Duties and
Responsibilities:


Serve
as a systems administrator, representing the needs of the O&S team.


Collaborate
with development and engineering teams.


Perform
system backups and recovery.


Maintain
data files and monitor system configuration to ensure data integrity.


Install
new software releases and system upgrades, to evaluate and install patches, and
to resolve system related problems.
  • Conduct Tier
    2 & 3 Server Administration.
  • Resolve a
    wide range of system issues, troubleshooting software, hardware, and
    network issues, and addressing trouble tickets and service tasks.
  • Assist with
    achieving optimum performance and availability standards through
    implementing appropriate technical solutions.
  • Conduct
    routine and emergency maintenance of all system elements.
  • Design &
    deploy Windows and Linux servers, with an emphasis on Linux.
  • Design,
    implement, and maintain critical system monitoring components (3 rd
    party tools and custom scripts).
  • Troubleshoot
    alerts generated by a server monitoring.
  • Read, modify,
    and generally develop bash scripts for monitoring and/or automation as
    necessary.
  • Communicate/coordinate
    scheduled PM windows with potentially impacted customers.
  • Communicate/coordinate
    scheduled authorized outages.
  • Lead
    continuous improvement and sustainment optimization efforts associated
    with a continuous improvement philosophy.
  • Maintain
    operational, configuration, and other standard operating procedures
    (SOPs).
  • Participate
    in the troubleshooting of system issues internally and coordinate efforts
    with third party providers and other operational support entities.
  • Collaborate
    and contribute to the development, administration, and testing of backup
    and recovery plans.
  • Schedule
    activities and/or meetings.
  • Interpret and
    discuss information which involves terminology or concepts not familiar to
    many.
  • Provide
    advice and recommend actions involving complex issues.
  • Train,
    instruct, and possibly evaluate performance.

Other
duties as assigned

Minimum
Qualifications: (To
perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each
essential duty satisfactorily.)


Bachelor's
Degree required.? Additional relevant
experience can be used in lieu of the degree requirement.


5
years of relevant system administration experience required, with an emphasis
on Linux.


Ability
to obtain TS/SCI and pass CI Poly.

Knowledge, Skills
and Abilities:


Ability to obtain DoD 8570 Level II Compliance
within 90 days of hire.
  • Ability
    to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
  • Ability
    to function as a team member, lead, and independently.

Strong
Red Hat Linux skills desired.


RHCSA
or higher certification desired.


AWS
experience desired.


Extensive
scripting experience desired.


Networking
experience desired.


Atlassian
suite experience desired.
  • Experience
    serving as the primary O&S interface to the customer desired.
  • Strong
    speaking, writing, and documentation skills.
  • Detail
    oriented.
Physical Demands:
(The physical demands described
here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to
successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable
accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform
the essential functions.)


While performing the duties of this
Job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee
is frequently required to walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach
with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; climb or
balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift
and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job
include close vision.

Work Environment: (The work environment
characteristics described here are representative of those an employee
encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.)


The employee will normally work in
a temperature-controlled office environment, with frequent exposure to
electronic office equipment.


During visits to areas of
operations, may be exposed to extreme cold or hot weather conditions.? Is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne
particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, and loud noise.
